page.title: 05A Special Event in 1985
page.content: The quatercentury celebrations of the foundation of{Hawkshead Grammar School on Saturday 22nd June 1985 began in the church with a peal of 5040 grandsire triples rung by local bellringers. A latin lesson was enacted by boys of the primary school under the tutelage of a member of the stage society. The afternoon celebrations included Tudor dancing, crowning the Rose Queen and drama performances in the primary school. Each family with a child at the school received a facsimile of the original school seal which was presented by Major Mervyn Sandys, a descendent of the founder of the school, Archbishop Sandys. In the evening a lecture was given in the church entitled "Four Hundred Years of Hawkshead School". On the Sunday a Thanksgiving service was held in the church.
